announcements.title: Food on the Move TODAY Dec 1 Sponsored by CHER
announcements.info: The Food on the Move fruit and vegetable market is coming TODAY 12-4 pm to the School of Public Heal...
announcements.more_info_text:
The Food on the Move fruit and vegetable market is coming TODAY 12-4 pm to the School of Public Health- 121 S. Main St Second Floor. All community members are welcome! The market is held on Fridays year-round from 12-4!
We accept cash, check, and EBT, as well as debit and credit cards.
To sign up for our newsletter and get text updates, go to http://eepurl.com/b1O3tT. For more info visit www.riphi.org/food-on-the-move or call 401.288.1956. Food on the Move is sponsored by the Center for Health Equity Research.

announcements.title: DEADLINE TODAY: WINTER BREAK NYC SYNAPSE
announcements.from_to: Jonathan M. Nelson Center for Entrepreneurship - All
announcements.info: Interested in learning more about startups? From January 21 - 23, travel with Brown EP to New York C...
announcements.more_info_text:
Interested in learning more about startups? From January 21 - 23, travel with Brown EP to New York City with thirty fellow Brown and RISD students to visit the greatest startup ecosystem on the East Coast. Engage one-on-one with leading innovators, inventors, and investors and tour the headquarters of renowned firms such as Ellevest, MongoDB, and BuzzFeed.

Explore the entrepreneurial community home to international media, fashion, and finance - all for free!

Interested students should apply by Friday, December 1, 2017. (See link below.)

announcements.title: Salsa Club's End of Year Social
announcements.info: Come celebrate the end of the year with some salsa dancing! The Brown Salsa Club is hosting a free s...
announcements.more_info_text: Come celebrate the end of the year with some salsa dancing! The Brown Salsa Club is hosting a free social in the Smith-Buonanno Lobby on Saturday, December 2. Open to everyone, no prior experience required. Lively from 10 pm - 2 am. The evening will kick off with a basic lesson at 9 pm.

announcements.title: Wintersession Course | Illuminated Sculptures
announcements.info: VISA 1150 - Illuminated Sculpture with Department of Visual Art Professor Paul Myoda. This course wi...
announcements.more_info_text: VISA 1150 - Illuminated Sculpture with Department of Visual Art Professor Paul Myoda. This course will run January 2 - January 19, 2018. This immersive wintersession studio course explores the material of light in the context of contemporary sculptural practice. Students develop sculptural solutions to a given set of problems. Contemporary art issues raised in presentations and discussions. Extensive outside work is expected. Besides in-class studio time, students should expect to work an additional 40 hours per week. This includes independent studio work, readings, online trainings, responsive writing, and research. When in class, be prepared to work, so collect all materials outside of studio time.

announcements.title: Propose to Direct Two Weeks In The upSpace (TWITS)
announcements.info: wanna create something wacky, wonderful, wild or profound in the pw upspace? want to put on a musica...
announcements.more_info_text:
wanna create something wacky, wonderful, wild or profound in the pw upspace? want to put on a musical? want a space to make your voice heard? want to direct just a plain ol' piece of neat theatre? want to direct something that is not theater or plain or able to be fully categorized?

GREAT! WE WANT YOU TO DO ALL OF THOSE THINGS! and MORE!

two weeks in the upspace (or TWITs) strikes a balance between an upspace lottery slot and a downspace slot. Like a downspace slot, you get a $300 budget and your show will be produced by the board. You also get two weeks, not one, in the space-- from february 14th-26th!

the deadline to submit proposals is monday, december 11 at 5pm.

please email abby (abigail_espiritu@brown.edu) and anthony (anthony_cherry@brown.edu) to be paired with a buddy, who will help you work on your proposal!

for more information about proposing to TWITS:
http://pw.brown.edu/twits.html

the pw upspace is a happenin' place. make stuff happen in it!!! we can't wait to hear what you're thinking!

announcements.title: English Department Announces Fall Writing Contests
announcements.from_to: Department of English - All Undergraduates, Campus Faculty, All Staff
announcements.info: The Department of English announces its Fall 2017 undergraduate writing contests.  Prize amounts ran...
announcements.more_info_text: The Department of English announces its Fall 2017 undergraduate writing contests.  Prize amounts range from $250 to $800 per prize and submissions are welcome from students of all concentrations.  Please visit:  http://brown.edu/go/english-prizes-fall for contest rules and a link to the online entry form.  Online submissions are due by Tuesday, December 12, 2017, by 3:00 pm.  No hard copies or late submissions will be accepted.

announcements.title: Soft Deadline for Declaring Leave of Absence
announcements.from_to: Matthew  Dang - All Undergraduates, Campus Faculty
announcements.info: Hey all, The Leavetaking Coordinators at the Curricular Resource Center wants to remind you that Dec...
announcements.more_info_text:
Hey all,
The Leavetaking Coordinators at the Curricular Resource Center wants to remind you that Dec. 1st is the soft deadline to declare a leave of absence for the Spring Semester. After the 1st, you can declare a leave of absence up to January 23rd, the day before the start of second semester. As you think about your decision, we encourage you to talk to faculty, deans, and other offices now to get support. Email us at leavetakers@gmail.com for more information.

Have you heard about PrEP (pre-exposure prophylaxis) one of the important new tools for HIV prevention? Click the link below to download and listen to this 4 minute podcast and learn the essentials about PrEP as well as cost and availability at Brown.

events.title: Is There an Emerging Crisis of Liberal Democracy?
events.info: The Swearer Center invites you to join Larry Diamond, senior fellow at the Hoover Institution and at...
events.more_info_text:
The Swearer Center invites you to join Larry Diamond, senior fellow at the Hoover Institution and at the Freeman Spogli Institute for International Studies at Stanford University, for a discussion on whether there is an emerging crisis of liberal democracy. Scott Warren ´09, Swearer Center Democracy Fellow and CEO of Generation Citizen, will moderate.

The discussion will take place today, December 1, at 12 p.m. in the Kasper Multipurpose Room.

events.title: TODAY- (Mis)Using Data Visualization in a Partisan
events.location_people: Joukowsky Forum, Watson Institute  - All Undergraduates, All Graduate Students, Campus Faculty, All Staff
events.info: Join Brown Political Review for a talk by data visualization expert Alberto Cairo (University of Mia...
events.more_info_text:
Join Brown Political Review for a talk by data visualization expert Alberto Cairo (University of Miami). Cairo will explain how to decode misleading charts, infographics, and data maps -- the visual aspect of "fake news" -- designed by individuals and organizations from across the political spectrum, and discuss why a graphically literate citizenry is essential to political and policy debates.

Alberto Cairo is a professor of professional practice at the University of Miami and a Knight Chair in Visual Journalism at the Knight Foundation.

Cosponsored by the Brown Political Review and the Taubman Center

events.title: South Asian Politics with Soledad Prillaman
events.location_people: McKinney Conference Room, Watson Institute  - All Undergraduates, Humanities Grad Students, Social Sciences Grad Students, Campus Faculty
events.info: Soledad Artiz Prillaman; When Women Mobilize: Dissecting India's Gender Gap in Political Repr...
events.more_info_text:
Soledad Artiz Prillaman ─ When Women Mobilize: Dissecting India´s Gender Gap in Political Representation

Soledad Artiz Prillaman recieved her Ph.D. from the Department of Government at Harvard University. Her research focuses on comparative political economy, economic development, gender, and the politics of the welfare state, with a regional focus in India.

Her dissertation seeks to better understand why women in India, and developing countries more broadly, are particularly disengaged from politics and to identify the mechanisms through which the prevailing political gender gap is reduced. In doing so, I evaluate the mechanisms by which the state is strengthened through increased political integration of women in India by detailing the oft-unconsidered consequences of development interventions for political behavior and local politics. Additionally it evaluates how women who have become active political agents organize politically and are received and resisted by traditional political networks.

Prior to entering Harvard, she received a B.A. in Political Science and Economics from Texas A&M University in 2011.

events.title: South Asian Politics with Soledad Prillaman
events.info: This afternoon, join Georgetown historian Dagomar Degroot for "Conflict and Climate Change: Lessons ...
events.more_info_text: This afternoon, join Georgetown historian Dagomar Degroot for "Conflict and Climate Change: Lessons from the Little Ice Age." During particularly chilly periods of the so-called 'Little Ice Age' that occurred between 1250 and 1850 CE, resource shortages repeatedly provoked or worsened rebellions within societies, and even wars between them. Yet new research into societal adaptation and resilience to Little Ice Age climate changes has revealed that cooling could also benefit armies and fleets on the battlefield. Degroot will explain how climate change therefore altered the character of violence in the early modern world, in ways that may provide parables for our warmer future.

Listen to their pitches and learn about their semester-long projects. Learn more at http://brownentrepreneurship.com/dojo/. Location: List Art 120; Time: 4:00 - 7:00 PM; Powered By The Jonathan M. Nelson Center for Entrepreneurship

events.title: Buddhist Practice 101
events.location_people: J. Walter Wilson Room 411 - All Students, All Staff
events.info: College Hill Buddhists for Peace at Brown University, sponsored by the Chaplain's office, is a stude...
events.more_info_text: College Hill Buddhists for Peace at Brown University, sponsored by the Chaplain's office, is a student/staff group based on Nichiren Buddhism. We meet every Friday to practice, study, and encourage one another, ultimately striving for global peace through positive changes in individuals. We also discuss current issues in society such as environmental problems, international/domestic conflicts, discriminations, etc. from the stand point of Nichiren Buddhism. Our meetings are open to all. Feel free to stop by even if you are just interested in hearing about Buddhist philosophy and practice. The next event will be on Friday, 12/1 4:30-5:15pm at J. Walter Wilson Room 411.
